thread.title: April Jones: Family's campaign to be debated in Parliament
thread.title_full: April Jones: Family's campaign to be debated in Parliament

title: April Jones: Family's campaign to be debated in Parliament
text:
caption Schoolgirl April Jones went missing from Machynlleth in October 2012 A campaign by the family of murdered schoolgirl April Jones calling for tougher sentences for sex offenders is set to be debated in Parliament. 
"April's Law" will be debated at Westminster Hall on Monday after reaching more than 100,000 signatures. 
It calls for sex offenders to remain on the register for life. 
Five-year-old April was killed by paedophile Mark Bridger after being snatched from outside her home in Machynlleth, Powys, in October 2012. 
Bridger was not on the sex offenders list but indecent images of young children were found on his computer. 
The new petition follows one set up in 2013, which attracted 70,000 signatures. 
April's sister Jazmin Jones has previously said the family was hopeful it would "get the law out", adding: "Even if it saves one child's life we'll prevent another family having to go through what we've been through." 
The family has also called for the internet to be better policed over images of child abuse. Image copyright Police Image caption Mark Bridger received a whole-life sentence for April's murder Related Topics
